intro: Barbosella spiritu-sanctensis, commonly known as the Holy Spirit Barbosella, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its unique, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is adapted to the arid and rocky environment of Socotra, showcasing a high degree of succulence in its leaves. It produces small, red berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by birds. This species is of particular interest to botanists due to its distinctive morphology and endemic status.
